definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
old tune/fig. conservative opinion/the same old stuff

sentences.english: So the widow one day entreated me to sing it to her thus.
sentences.chinese: 因此這位寡婦有一天請求我用這調子唱給她聽。

sentences.english: I love this ode to slow-moving.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡這種慢步的調子。

sentences.english: On this high note the puppet show commences .
sentences.chinese: 木偶戲就在這陣高昂的調子裏開場了。

sentences.english: After you have been playing for some time, you may wish to buy harmonicas in other keys as well.
sentences.chinese: 學習一段時間以後，你可以考慮高買其他調子的口琴。

sentences.english: She advises keeping small talk finely tuned and topical.
sentences.chinese: 她建議閒聊時要定好調子選好話題。

sentences.english: As for Cambodia, the media's themes were familiar.
sentences.chinese: 至於柬埔寨，新聞界的調子是久已熟知的。

sentences.english: He strummed on the piano and told me about the tune.
sentences.chinese: 他在鋼琴上彈了幾下，然後告訴我就這個調子。

sentences.english: Women Current in the video singing a little tune, sound beautiful, good to hear.
sentences.chinese: 一次女流在視頻裏唱的小調子，音質很美，很好聽。

sentences.english: If you can hold a tune, sing a love song.
sentences.chinese: 如果你懂調子，就唱一首情歌。

sentences.english: The church bell clashed its melancholy note.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的鐘敲出悲涼的調子。

sentences.english: As a result they have well-toned bodies.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他們有良好的調子機構。

sentences.english: Hollow and abstract tune should sing little here, but some people sing it more.
sentences.chinese: 這裏叫空洞抽象的調子少唱，有些同志卻硬要多唱。

sentences.english: Their exchange set the tone for a new relationship.
sentences.chinese: 他們交換意見爲建立新關係定了調子。

sentences.english: More importantly than all of that, she sings in tune.
sentences.chinese: 比所有這些更重要的是，她唱得全合調子。

sentences.english: She transposed the song into a different key.
sentences.chinese: 她把這首歌變成另一種調子。

sentences.english: The violin is not quite in tune with the piano.
sentences.chinese: 請調整你小提琴的調子使之興鋼琴和諧。

definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
